012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
013
014import java.nio.charset.Charset;
015
016import java.sql.ResultSet;
017import java.sql.SQLException;
018
019import java.util.Iterator;
020
021import org.postgresql.pljava.ResultSetProvider;
022import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
023import static
024    org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function.OnNullInput.RETURNS_NULL;
025import static org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function.Effects.IMMUTABLE;
026import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
027
028import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CharsetEncoding;
029import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.CharsetEncoding.SERVER_ENCODING;
030import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.CharsetEncoding.clientEncoding;
031
032/**
033 * Example using the {@link CharsetEncoding CharsetEncoding} interface.
034 */
035public class CharsetEncodings implements ResultSetProvider.Large
036{
037    /**
038     * Enumerate PostgreSQL's known character set encodings, indicating for
039     * each one whether it is the server encoding, whether it's the client
040     * encoding, its PostgreSQL name, its corresponding Java
041     * {@link Charset Charset} name, and the Java module that provides it.
042     */
043    @Function(
044        schema = "javatest",
045        out = {
046            "server boolean", "client boolean", "server_usable boolean",
047            "ordinal int", "pg_name text", "icu_name text",
048            "java_name text", "module text"
049        }
050    )
051    public static ResultSetProvider charsets()
052    {
053        return new CharsetEncodings();
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Enumerate Java's known character set encodings, trying to map them to
058     * PostgreSQL encodings, and indicating for
059     * each one whether it is the server encoding, whether it's the client
060     * encoding, its PostgreSQL name, its corresponding Java
061     * {@link Charset Charset} name, and the Java module that provides it.
062     */
063    @Function(
064        schema = "javatest",
065        out = {
066            "server boolean", "client boolean", "server_usable boolean",
067            "ordinal int", "pg_name text", "icu_name text",
068            "java_name text", "module text"
069        }
070    )
071    public static ResultSetProvider java_charsets(boolean try_aliases)
072    {
073        return new JavaEncodings(try_aliases);
074    }
075
076    @Override
077    public void close()
078    {
079    }
080
081    @Override
082    public boolean assignRowValues(ResultSet receiver, long currentRow)
083    throws SQLException
084    {
085        /*
086         * Shamelessly exploit the fact that currentRow will be passed as
087         * consecutive values starting at zero and that's the same way PG
088         * encodings are numbered.
089         */
090
091        CharsetEncoding cse;
092
093        try
094        {
095            cse = CharsetEncoding.fromOrdinal((int)currentRow);
096        }
097        catch ( IllegalArgumentException e )
098        {
099            return false;
100        }
101
102        if ( SERVER_ENCODING == cse )
103            receiver.updateBoolean("server", true);
104        if ( clientEncoding() == cse )
105            receiver.updateBoolean("client", true);
106        if ( cse.usableOnServer() )
107            receiver.updateBoolean("server_usable", true);
108        receiver.updateInt("ordinal", cse.ordinal());
109        receiver.updateString("pg_name", cse.name());
110        receiver.updateString("icu_name", cse.icuName());
111
112        Charset cs = cse.charset();
113        if ( null == cs )
114            return true;
115
116        receiver.updateString("java_name", cs.name());
117        receiver.updateString("module", cs.getClass().getModule().getName());
118
119        return true;
120    }
121
122    static class JavaEncodings implements ResultSetProvider.Large
123    {
124        final Iterator<Charset> iter =
125            Charset.availableCharsets().values().iterator();
126        final boolean tryAliases;
127
128        JavaEncodings(boolean tryAliases)
129        {
130            this.tryAliases = tryAliases;
131        }
132
133        @Override
134        public void close()
135        {
136        }
137
138        @Override
139        public boolean assignRowValues(ResultSet receiver, long currentRow)
140        throws SQLException
141        {
142            if ( ! iter.hasNext() )
143                return false;
144
145            Charset cs = iter.next();
146
147            receiver.updateString("java_name", cs.name());
148            receiver.updateString("module",
149                cs.getClass().getModule().getName());
150
151            CharsetEncoding cse = null;
152
153            try
154            {
155                cse = CharsetEncoding.fromName(cs.name());
156            }
157            catch ( IllegalArgumentException e )
158            {
159            }
160
161            /*
162             * If the canonical Java name didn't match up with a PG encoding,
163             * try the first match found for any of the Java charset's aliases.
164             * This is not an especially dependable idea: the aliases are a Set,
165             * so they don't enumerate in a reproducible order, and some Java
166             * aliases are PG aliases for different charsets.
167             */
168            if ( null == cse  &&  tryAliases )
169            {
170                for ( String alias : cs.aliases() )
171                {
172                    try
173                    {
174                        cse = CharsetEncoding.fromName(alias);
175                        break;
176                    }
177                    catch ( IllegalArgumentException e )
178                    {
179                    }
180                }
181            }
182
183            if ( null == cse )
184                return true;
185
186            if ( SERVER_ENCODING == cse )
187                receiver.updateBoolean("server", true);
188            if ( clientEncoding() == cse )
189                receiver.updateBoolean("client", true);
190            if ( cse.usableOnServer() )
191                receiver.updateBoolean("server_usable", true);
192            receiver.updateInt("ordinal", cse.ordinal());
193            receiver.updateString("pg_name", cse.name());
194            receiver.updateString("icu_name", cse.icuName());
195
196            return true;
197        }
198    }
199}
